verses.verse: The oracle <S%H9294><s%> concerning Moab. <S%H4124><s%> Surely <S%H3588><s%> in a night <S%H3915><s%> Ar <S%H6144><s%> of Moab <S%H4124><s%> is devastated <S%H7703><s%> [and] ruined; <S%H1820><s%> Surely <S%H3588><s%> in a night <S%H3915><s%> Kir <S%H7024><s%> of Moab <S%H4124><s%> is devastated <S%H7703><s%> [and] ruined. <S%H1820><s%>

They have gone <S%H5927><s%> up to the temple <S%H1004><s%> and [to] Dibon, <S%H1769><s%> [even] to the high <S%H1116><s%> places <S%H1116><s%> to weep. <S%H1065><s%> Moab <S%H4124><s%> wails <S%H3213><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> Nebo <S%H5015><s%> and Medeba; <S%H4311><s%> Everyone's head <S%H7218><s%> is bald <S%H7144><s%> [and] every <S%H3605><s%> beard <S%H2206><s%> is cut <S%H1639><s%> off. <S%H1639><s%>

In their streets <S%H2351><s%> they have girded <S%H2296><s%> themselves with sackcloth; <S%H8242><s%> On their housetops <S%H1406><s%> and in their squares <S%H7339><s%> Everyone <S%H3605><s%> is wailing, <S%H3213><s%> dissolved <S%H3381><s%> in tears. <S%H1065><s%>

Heshbon <S%H2809><s%> and Elealeh <S%H500><s%> also cry <S%H2199><s%> out, Their voice <S%H6963><s%> is heard <S%H8085><s%> all <S%H5704><s%> the way <S%H5704><s%> to Jahaz; <S%H3096><s%> Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> the armed <S%H9139><s%> men of Moab <S%H4124><s%> cry <S%H7321><s%> aloud; <S%H7321><s%> His soul <S%H5315><s%> trembles <S%H3415><s%> within him.

My heart <S%H3820><s%> cries <S%H2199><s%> out for Moab; <S%H4124><s%> His fugitives <S%H1281><s%> are as far <S%H5704><s%> as Zoar <S%H6820><s%> [and] Eglath-shelishiyah, For they go <S%H5927><s%> up the ascent <S%H4608><s%> of Luhith <S%H3872><s%> weeping; <S%H1065><s%> Surely <S%H3588><s%> on the road <S%H1870><s%> to Horonaim <S%H2773><s%> they raise <S%H5782><s%> a cry <S%H2201><s%> of distress <S%H2201><s%> over [their] ruin. <S%H7667><s%>

For the waters <S%H4325><s%> of Nimrim <S%H5249><s%> are desolate. <S%H4923><s%> Surely <S%H3588><s%> the grass <S%H2682><s%> is withered, <S%H3001><s%> the tender <S%H1877><s%> grass <S%H1877><s%> died <S%H3615><s%> out, There is no <S%H3808><s%> green <S%H3418><s%> thing. <S%H3418><s%>

Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> the abundance <S%H3502><s%> [which] they have acquired <S%H6213><s%> and stored <S%H6486><s%> up They carry <S%H5375><s%> off over <S%H5921><s%> the brook <S%H5158><s%> of Arabim. <S%H6155><s%>

For the cry <S%H2201><s%> of distress <S%H2201><s%> has gone <S%H5362><s%> around <S%H5362><s%> the territory <S%H1366><s%> of Moab, <S%H4124><s%> Its wail <S%H3215><s%> [goes] as far <S%H5704><s%> as Eglaim <S%H97><s%> and its wailing <S%H3213><s%> even to Beer-elim.

For the waters <S%H4325><s%> of Dimon <S%H1775><s%> are full <S%H4390><s%> of blood; <S%H1818><s%> Surely <S%H3588><s%> I will bring <S%H7896><s%> added <S%H3254><s%> [woes] upon Dimon, <S%H1775><s%> A lion <S%H9030><s%> upon the fugitives <S%H6413><s%> of Moab <S%H4124><s%> and upon the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of the land. <S%H127><s%>
